intro: Arthrophyllum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean arthrophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine by local communities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
